http://sciencealert.com/four-elements-have-just-earned-a-permanent-spot-in-the-periodic-table
http://sciencealert.com/europe-plans-to-build-a-moon-village-by-2030-space-agency-announces
http://sciencealert.com/<p>One%20gene%20can%20explain%20the%20conflicting%20hypotheses%20about%20what%20causes%20the%20disease.</p>%20<hr%20id="system-readmore"%20/>%20<p>Researchers%20have%20found%20a%20gene%20that%20links%20the%20three%20previously%20unrelated%20biological%20changes%20most%20commonly%20blamed%20for%20causing%20schizophrenia,%20making%20it%20one%20of%20the%20most%20promising%20culprits%20for%20the%20disease%20so%20far,%20and%20a%20good%20target%20for%20future%20treatments.</p>%20<p>Schizophrenia%20is%20a%20debilitating%20mental%20disorder%20that%20usually%20appears%20in%20late%20adolescence,%20and%20changes%20the%20way%20people%20think,%20act%20and%20perceive%20reality.%20For%20decades,%20scientists%20have%20struggled%20to%20work%20out%20what%20causes%20the%20hallucinations%20and%20strange%20behaviour%20associated%20with%20the%20disorder,%20and%20keep%20coming%20back%20to%20three%20neuronal%20changes%20that%20seem%20to%20be%20to%20blame.%20The%20only%20problem%20is%20that%20the%20changes%20seemed%20to%20be%20unrelated,%20and,%20in%20some%20cases,%20even%20contradictory.</p>%20<p>But%20now,%20researchers%20from%20Duke%20University%20in%20the%20UK%20have%20managed%20to%20find%20a%20link%20between%20these%20three%20hypotheses,%20and%20have%20shown%20that%20all%20three%20changes%20can%20be%20brought%20about%20by%20a%20malfunction%20in%20the%20same%20gene.</p>%20<p><a%20href="http:/www.nature.com/neuro/journal/vaop/ncurrent/full/nn.4015.html">Publishing%20in%20</a><em><a%20href="http:/www.nature.com/neuro/journal/vaop/ncurrent/full/nn.4015.html">Nature%20Neuroscience</a>,%20</em>the%20researchers%20explain%20that%20their%20results%20could%20lead%20to%20new%20treatment%20strategies%20that%20target%20the%20underlying%20cause%20of%20the%20disease,%20rather%20than%20the%20visible%20changes%20or%20phenotypes,%20associated%20with%20schizophrenia.</p>%20<p>"The%20most%20exciting%20part%20was%20when%20all%20the%20pieces%20of%20the%20puzzle%20fell%20together,"%20lead%20researcher%20Scott%20Soderling,%20a%20professor%20of%20cell%20biology%20and%20neurobiology%20from%20Duke%20University,%20<a%20href="http:/www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2015/05/150504120805.htm">said%20in%20a%20press%20release</a>.%20"When%20[co-researcher%20Il%20Hwan%20Kim]%20and%20I%20finally%20realised%20that%20these%20three%20outwardly%20unrelated%20phenotypes%20...%20were%20actually%20functionally%20interrelated%20with%20each%20other,%20that%20was%20really%20surprising%20and%20also%20very%20exciting%20for%20us."</p>%20<p>So%20what%20are%20these%20three%20phenotypes?%20The%20first%20is%20spine%20purning,%20which%20means%20that%20the%20neurons%20of%20people%20with%20schizophrenia%20have%20fewer%20spines%20-%20the%20long%20part%20of%20a%20brain%20cell%20that%20passes%20signals%20back%20and%20forth.%20Some%20people%20with%20schizophrenia%20also%20have%20hyperactive%20neurons,%20and%20excess%20<a%20href="http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dopamine">dopamine</a>%20production.%20<a%20href="http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dopamine"><br%20/></a></p>%20<p>But%20these%20changes%20just%20didn't%20seem%20to%20make%20sense%20together.%20After%20all,%20how%20could%20neurons%20be%20overactive%20if%20they%20didn't%20have%20enough%20dendritic%20spines%20to%20pass%20messages%20back%20and%20forth,%20and%20why%20would%20either%20of%20these%20symptoms%20trigger%20excess%20dopamine%20production?%20Now%20the%20researchers%20believe%20that%20a%20mutation%20in%20the%20gene%20Arp2/3%20may%20be%20to%20blame.</p>%20<p>They'd%20originally%20spotted%20the%20gene%20during%20previous%20studies,%20which%20identified%20<a%20href="schizophrenia-is-actually-eight-genetically-distinct-disorders-study-reveals">thousands%20of%20genes%20</a>%20linked%20to%20schizophrenia.%20But%20Arp2/3%20was%20of%20particular%20interest,%20as%20it%20controls%20the%20formation%20of%20synapses,%20or%20links,%20between%20neurons.</p>%20<p>To%20test%20its%20effect,%20the%20researchers%20engineered%20mice%20that%20didn't%20have%20the%20Arp2/3%20gene%20and,%20surprisingly,%20found%20that%20they%20behaved%20very%20similarly%20to%20humans%20with%20schizophrenia.%20The%20mice%20also%20got%20worse%20with%20age%20and%20improved%20slightly%20with%20antipsychotic%20medications,%20both%20traits%20of%20human%20schizophrenia.</p>%20<p>But%20most%20fascinating%20was%20the%20fact%20that%20the%20mice%20also%20had%20all%20three%20of%20the%20unrelated%20brain%20changes%20-%20fewer%20dendritic%20spines,%20overactive%20neurons%20and%20excess%20dopamine%20production.</p>%20<p>They%20also%20took%20things%20one%20step%20further%20and%20showed,%20for%20the%20first%20time,%20that%20this%20lack%20of%20dendritic%20spines%20can%20actually%20trigger%20hyperactive%20neurons.%20This%20is%20because%20the%20mice's%20brain%20cells%20rewire%20themselves%20to%20bypass%20these%20spines,%20effectively%20skipping%20the%20'filter'%20that%20usually%20keeps%20their%20activity%20in%20check.</p>%20<p>They%20also%20showed%20that%20these%20overactive%20neurons%20at%20the%20front%20of%20the%20brain%20were%20then%20stimulating%20other%20neurons%20to%20dump%20out%20dopamine.</p>%20<p>"Overall,%20the%20combined%20results%20reveal%20how%20three%20separate%20pathologies,%20at%20the%20tiniest%20molecular%20level,%20can%20converge%20and%20fuel%20a%20psychiatric%20disorder,"%20Susan%20Scutti%20<a%20href="http:/www.medicaldaily.com/what-causes-schizophrenia-scientists-find-clues-3-different-forms-neuronal-activity-331978">explains%20over%20at%20Medical%20Daily</a>.</p>%20<p>The%20group%20will%20now%20study%20the%20role%20Arp2/3%20plays%20in%20different%20parts%20of%20the%20brain,%20and%20how%20its%20linked%20to%20other%20schizophrenia%20symptoms.%20The%20research%20is%20still%20in%20its%20very%20early%20stages,%20and%20obviously%20has%20only%20been%20demonstrated%20in%20mice%20and%20not%20humans.%20But%20it's%20a%20promising%20first%20step%20towards%20understanding%20this%20mysterious%20disease.</p>%20<p>"We're%20very%20excited%20about%20using%20this%20type%20of%20approach,%20where%20we%20can%20genetically%20rescue%20Arp2/3%20function%20in%20different%20brain%20regions%20and%20normalise%20behaviours,"%20<a%20href="http:/www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2015/05/150504120805.htm">Soderling%20said</a>.%20"We'd%20like%20to%20use%20that%20as%20a%20basis%20for%20mapping%20out%20the%20neural%20circuitry%20and%20defects%20that%20also%20drive%20these%20other%20behaviours."</p>
